Economic benefits: A universal language would facilitate international trade and investment, as businesses and governments would no longer have to navigate the complexities of language barriers.
Improved education: Adopting a single language would make it easier for students to learn other languages, as they would be exposed to a common linguistic foundation.
Cultural preservation: A universal language could help preserve endangered languages by providing an alternative means of communication for speakers of minority languages.
Reduced military tensions: Greater understanding and communication among nations could potentially reduce the risk of conflict and military confrontation.

Enhanced global governance: A universal language could facilitate more effective communication among international organizations and bodies, improving decision-making and cooperation on global issues.
